title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file and the user tries to shutdown/reboot the computer using the Windows Start menu, there should be a warning or question message box asking if the user wants to save their dirty files before proceeding with the shutdown.
SR:
1. Launch WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Verify that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to initiate a shutdown or reboot of the computer.
5. Observe that there is no warning or question message box asking if the user wants to save their dirty files before proceeding with the shutdown.
